senses.de: Absolutely necessary for a whole, complete, or the final result
senses.ex: An integral part of the team

Tips.title: Necessity
Tips.description: It signals that something is so important that without it, the whole cannot function or be complete.
Tips.example: Having trust is integral to a successful partnership.

Tips.title: Non-substitutable
Tips.description: When something is integral, it can't be easily replaced or left out without affecting the outcome.
Tips.example: Good communication is integral to maintaining healthy relationships.

Tips.title: Unifying Role
Tips.description: It often describes how parts come together to form a coherent whole.
Tips.example: Each department plays an integral role in the company's success.

senses.de: Included as part of the whole
senses.ex: He is an integral part of the community

Tips.title: Inclusion
Tips.description: Usage emphasizes that something is a part of a whole, commonly found in group or community contexts.
Tips.example: Respect for others is an integral value in our school.

Tips.title: Implicit Presence
Tips.description: Indicates that something is naturally present within something else, not just added on.
Tips.example: Cultural traditions are an integral part of a nation's identity.

senses.de: In mathematics, a process of finding integrals, opposite of derivative
senses.ex: In calculus, we learned how to solve integrals

Tips.title: Math Concept
Tips.description: Refers to a specific calculation in calculus, not to be confused with general use of the word.
Tips.example: The area under the curve can be found using the integral.

Tips.title: Calculus Application
Tips.description: Mainly used in an academic or educational setting related to advanced math.
Tips.example: We will discuss the fundamental theorem of calculus which connects derivatives and integrals.

Tips.title: Different Types
Tips.description: Within mathematics, it specifies various types of calculations, not just one.
Tips.example: He solved the surface integral by parametrizing the surface.

Basic.wordDefinition:
Basic refers to something that is fundamental or essential, and is often used when describing something that is necessary for understanding or accomplishing a task.

For example, a basic understanding of math is essential for solving complex problems.

Basic refers to something that is necessary to get started, while integral refers to something that is necessary for a complete understanding or achievement of a goal.

Constituent.wordDefinition:
Constituent refers to a single part or element that makes up a larger whole. For example, the constituents of air are nitrogen, oxygen, and other gases.

In simpler terms, constituent refers to a smaller part that makes up a whole, whereas integral refers to something that is necessary for the whole to function properly.

Essential.wordDefinition:
Essential means something that is absolutely necessary or crucial for something to work or exist. For example, water is essential for the survival of humans.

Both words imply necessity, but essential has a stronger sense of being mandatory, while integral implies importance but may not be absolutely necessary.

To summarize, essential is used when talking about something that is absolutely necessary, and integral is used when talking about something that is important or necessary for completeness or wholeness.

Fundamental.wordDefinition:
Fundamental refers to something that is basic or essential to understanding or functioning.

It describes the core principles or concepts of a subject, such as the fundamental laws of physics or the fundamental principles of democracy.

To summarize, fundamental refers to the core principles or concepts of a subject, while integral refers to the necessary parts or components of a larger system or entity.

Indispensable.wordDefinition:
Indispensable means something that is absolutely necessary or cannot be done without. It implies that if that thing is missing, the whole process or event will come to a standstill.

For example, oxygen is indispensable for human survival.

In essence, indispensable is used when something is critical and cannot be done without, whereas integral implies a necessary component of a system, but not necessarily the end-all, be-all.

Intrinsic.wordDefinition:
Integral means something that is essential or necessary for completeness, while intrinsic refers to something that is inherent or natural to a particular thing or situation.

For example, in a car, the engine is integral as it is necessary for the car to function properly, while the color of the car is intrinsic as it is a natural characteristic of the car itself.

Integral would be applicable when referring to something that is crucial or necessary, while intrinsic would be used when describing a characteristic that is inherent or natural to something.

Necessary.wordDefinition:
Integral means essential, fundamental or necessary for completeness. It means something is so important that without it, the whole plan or system will not work as it should.

Necessary means something that is required or needed. It indicates that a specific thing must be done or acquired to achieve a particular goal or objective.

For example, wearing a seatbelt is necessary for safety while driving. Also, having the right qualifications is necessary to get a job.

The difference between the two words is that integral refers to something that is fundamental and essential for the completeness of a system, whereas necessary refers to something required or needed to achieve a goal or objective.

Vital.wordDefinition:
Integral and vital are both words used to describe something that is very important or necessary, but they have slightly different meanings.

Vital refers to something that is absolutely necessary for the continuation of life or health.

It describes something that is essential for living beings. For example: "Water is vital to all living creatures." In this example, the statement means that water is absolutely necessary for all living beings to survive and thrive.

Integral is used when describing something that is essential to the completeness of something larger, while vital is used when describing something that is absolutely necessary for life or health.

quotes.Text: Policing is an integral part of governance. It is a whole, but it is also a part of the larger whole. Just like a human organ like the head, it's got intelligence, stamina, strategy and surveillance. But it cannot function independently in the absence of other life-sustaining organs.
quotes.Title: Indian Activist
quotes.Name: Kiran Bedi

quotes.Text: Make-up are the first people the actors go to on set every day - they see you at your most vulnerable. Then they paint the character on you, they're integral to that transformation. It's such an intimate art form that you develop a really close relationship with your make-up artist.
quotes.Name: Ncuti Gatwa

quotes.Text: As an actress, I value and rely on peaceful self-expression, not only in my daily life, but also in my professional work. This is particularly true, as my commitment to the promotion of human rights is an integral part of my calling as an artist.
quotes.Title: British Actress
quotes.Name: Nazanin Boniadi

quotes.Text: I'm a firm believer, and some people may disagree, and I'm happy to have a beer with them and talk about it, but I believe that locations are such an integral character to the movie.
quotes.Title: Australian Diplomat
quotes.Name: Greig Fraser

quotes.Text: The shape and solutions of the future rely totally on the collective effort of people working together. We are all an integral part of the web of life.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Jacque Fresco

quotes.Text: Broadcasting's best days lie ahead as both an engine of local economies and as an integral part of tomorrow's technological world.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gordon Smith

quotes.Text: Music is a fantastic peacekeeper of the world, it is integral to harmony, and it is a required fundamental of human emotion.
quotes.Title: Chinese Philosopher
quotes.Name: Xun Kuang

quotes.Text: That said, everything's important, and every musician who plays on the record is an integral part of it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jerry Harrison

quotes.Text: Music has always been so integral to my life. It's always been my work and my passion.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Jon Hopkins

quotes.Text: Make-up is an integral part of my lifestyle because of the profession I'm in.

quotes.Name: Kirti Kulhari
